decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed enlargement of the dwellinghouse would extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 6 metres, therefore the proposal would not be within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, A.1 (g) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, as amended.

Reason : 2 - The proposed enlargement of the dwellinghouse would extend beyond an original side wall and exceed more than half the width of the original dwelling. The proposal would not be within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, A.1(j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended.

Reason : 3 - Notwithstanding the above, the measurements provided in section 5 of the application form and the submitted drawings are inconsistent. Therefore, the local planning authority is unable to make an informed determination due to inconsistencies in information provided to comply with condition A.4(2)(a) and (iii) of Class A of Schedule 2, Part 1 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, as amended.
description: Single storey rear extension: 6.00 metres deep, 3.00 metres maximum height and 2.55 metres high to the eaves
